name: arcibi
text: More TV news outlets should use wacky fonts

name: the_stoned_one
text: they should use wingdings so that blind people can read them

name: greyfield
text: I thought it was kind of amusing that Scott Peterson qualifies as "Animal News".

name: greenkoolayd
text: amusingly accurate

name: lizjones
text: You would think Lyle vomiting would not be that newsworthy.

name: gkiyo
text: Rewinding Blue's Clues was newsworthy, though.

name: woodenteeth
text: What is newsworthy is Philippe's nonchalant reaction of "I had to rewind a little". Newsworthy in that it's funny. Meaning that I'm glad Onstad put in... errr... etc.

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by zcross00, riotdejaneiro, Overmedicated, Thorfinn, GeyserShitdick, GMM, Endquote, petro, Sargasm, atticusonline, mustconcentrate, BillyLK, luckypyjamas, aHatOfPig, foetus_punch, orrrderup, nutmeg, bixschmix, Madoushi, Dainbramage, Rakadin, emgee, pogo, Pigs)

name: halfdirt
text: A comment left by halfdirt was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Vondicus, mercuri0us, farqussus, atticusonline, aHatOfPig, ravindra108, Brosaurus, bixschmix, scraggg, Doc_Rostov, Pigs)

name: bixschmix
text: Sorry halfdirt. I don't know if you were mocking asherdan or not, but I have this thing about laming him when he calls the author "'Stad." (Because it's lame.) I would be remiss if I didn't apply the same standard to everyone that uses this annoying-ass word.

name: dopamine
text: wow someones uptight haha. sweet avatar by the way. he threw a knife into heaven.

name: greenkoolayd
text: the comic isnt from circumstances, doofie.

name: twohundredninety
text: Pay close attention to the warning! It is a matter of safety.

name: closefriend
text: Oh, Philippe, Ultra Peanut likes you fine. She just thinks you're a real homo jackass!

name: yingkaixing
text: Ultra Peanut shows her affection in wonderful ways. He's right, though. It's hard to have a girlfriend when she's Asian and doesn't like you.

name: spinynorman
text: Philippe and I are alike in our willingness to be abused by Asian women. The difference is that all he has to do is make conversation, whereas I have to arrange for a room at distant motel and provide the woman in question with a variety of elaborate and expensive "gifts" which may readily be exchanged for cash money at certain businesses. In this, Achewood is both like life, and unalike. Interesting.

name: boredom_man
text: ...Jimbo Wales? Is that you?

name: courtland
text: Make that a super-size homo jackass.

name: junko
text: I choose to believe that Onstad actually called the zoo ask asked which animal had the biggest butt.

name: wae
text: A comment left by wae was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fell, goocifer, GeyserShitdick, Smartacus, scraggg, clintisiceman)

name: geysershitdick
text: zing

name: saru
text: OH YOU ARE J-LO'S MOM AND YOU JUST TOOK HER TO SCHOOL IN THE CAR OF PAIN!

name: greenkoolayd
text: the plymouth voyager of pain , even...

name: usversusthem
text: Astute readers will note that this discussion took place a good year or so before celebrity photozoologists in California discovered the Kimberlus kardashii , now recognized to have buns up to 15% bigger than J-Lo's.

name: aelindil
text: I'm sorry to report that there is no Kid's Zoo in Seattle.  There is Woodland Park, however.

name: juanclaudius
text: Woodland Park is notable for having a zoo in it and also being where everyone drinks beer for the first time. This is a Tradition.

name: howl
text: Really? I did not know about that second one. Huh. Well, it's too late for me.

name: crinklebat
text: Man, I thought my family was the only one with kids totally obsessed with sending things in to Reader's Digest. The $400 or whatever that they were willing to pay seems like enough to set a kid up for life.

name: lrosetw8
text: Godammit Philippe why are you so cute?!

name: artifakt
text: I once tried making a cookie in a sort of mannish shape. It came out as this sort of blobbish monster. This was before I knew about gingerbread men.

name: pogo
text: Once when I had only hotdog buns available, I made sausage shaped hamburgers.  Tasted fine.

name: planetidiot
text: This is called a "burger pipe"

name: ggvaidya
text:
Yeah, I know what you're thinking, "just butt out." You may not be used to this, but I actually just butted out.

What could that possibly mean ? Whatever it is, it's comedy gold!

name: bixschmix
text: It means he rarely butts out, but that he now is doing so.

name: tekende
text: I don't think Philippe understands what "butt out" actually means.

name: tekende
text: For some reason I love how Philippe specifically points out Wendy's in parentheses as being the only outlet to provide square hamburgers.

name: heccibiggs
text: Doesn't Whitecastle do square burgers? I've never been to one, I've just watched Harold and Kumar Get the Munchies several times.

name: pogo
text: Whitecastle is very limited in geogrpahic range, I believe, mainly East Coast and maybe Chicago.  And while they are kinda square, they are more globlike and small.

name: mattylite
text: I'd call 'em square.  Whitey's is all over the upper & central midwest, from MN down to MO and TN, and with a delicate tendril extending northeast to OH and NY.  Also, having though this hard about it, the chances of me eating White Castle today are now at 95 percent.

name: tekende
text: I am pretty sure Hardee's has/had square hamburgers as well, though I could be wrong.

name: yomimono
text: I'll back you up on that.

name: i_love_kate
text: Your name means "reading material" in Japanese. I know this.

name: yomimono
text: I've been thinking of changing it to "I spent high school studying languages instead of having friends or sex", so everyone who has not studied Japanese could understand it also.

name: aliiis
text:
is this... the saddest thing?

(P S I started out studying Japanese and Linguistics, but dropped Japanese after two years so I could have more friends and sex. eetoo, joozu ja nai. :\)

name: i_love_kate
text:
Hey! I did this too! (Dropping Japanese after two years of study)

Maybe ju an' me are tomodachi!

name: aliiis
text: Aye and hai!

name: i_love_kate
text:
So how about that kanji.

It is pretty crappy stuff, eh.

name: dasilodavi
text:
Welcome to the internet. You are not alone.

You ARE a hard one to track down though, assetbar-wise I mean. How was the after-party with Onstad?

name: yomimono
text:
My feelings on that asset were pro. It was this dance party with lots of very attractive women, who were dancing in very attractive ways. Plus I got pictures with Onstad and 2/3 of Freezepop. Basically it was everything I thought it could be.

Was improv awesome? I am guessing it was.

name: dasilodavi
text: It wasn't bad.  I forget how that particular night went, but I think it was a good show.  Let me know when you're in the Boston area again, I'll drag you out to it.

name: soticoto
text:
Technically... Hippos are horse COUSINS... not grandparents.

They both descended from a fairly recent (geologically speaking) common ancestor.
Straight-up though... Philippe got it pretty close. He is a smart kid, which goes against those evil naysayers who claim him to be retarded.

name: orvel
text: He is five.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Roast Beef: So things with me and Molly.
Teodor: Ray is such a moron.
Mr. Bear: Someone has left a cornichon in the toilet.
Lyle: itwas the jellies
Little Nephew: I B a SuicideGirls model

name: biznart
text: I can't stop laughing about Mr. Bear's entry.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Jesus, I thought it was a turd shaped like a cornichon. You know, pickles.

name: i_love_kate
text: Reading Lyle's entry, this seems likely.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Yeah, there goes Lyle, unknown artiste and his revolutionary, freudian artform. Someday, just wait!

name: tekende
text: COWBOY OFFICE

name: deusoma
text: The picture of Phillipe chewing is much more adorable than I would have expected. Awwwwww.

name: dapooka
text: Is it just me or does the Phillipe Times get better and better with each new issue?

name: achilleselbow
text: There is a place in Hackensack, NJ called White Mana, and their burgers are shaped like random blobs. They are the best burgers I have ever had. They come with onions and cost 89 cents. You must have some. You must have some right now.

name: gouldgonewild
text: Man, you could totally run a sweet white weanies deck if you ate there enough

name: tekende
text: I don't know what that means

name: fineoakstructure
text: SWEET WHITE WEANIES

name: carlyle
text: I STILL DON'T KNOW WHAT IT MEANS

name: greenkoolayd
text: i just looked it up.  its got something to do with magic: the gathering.

name: tekende
text: Oooohhhhhh. White mana. Okay. Thanks.

name: halbermensch
text: I used to man the grill at Culver's, where I occasionally made curved burgers. I wish I could claim Friday Facts as my inspiration, but my burgercurving was always unintentional.

name: tbtabby
text: What does Philippe mean by "curved?" I'm picturing a crescent-shaped patty, but it could also mean one that has a concave surface due to uneven cooking.

name: bozendoka
text: I'm going with the kind of curved that you might serve on a croissant.

name: osakimandias
text:
I like that Philippe wants to be on record as coming out against shooting a hippo. Looking like you're soft on shooting hippos is exactly the kind of thing that could derail a presidential bid if it were discovered.

It is like having Todd for a running mate, except with less cocaine and more adverts with a slow flyover view of the African savanna and a pleading voice telling us we could lose this treasure forever unless we act now and also give them just a little money.

name: azairborne
text: The old "Frisco Burger" was ovular in shape...

name: i_love_kate
text: Sorry, Philippe! When my old English teacher was on holiday in North Africa, his guide had to shoot a hippo that was attacking them. It is one of his favourite stories, after the one where he met Jim Broadbent and the one where he set his hands and head on fire by accident.

name: miku224
text: Your teacher sounds wonderful.  Man, I kinda miss high school.  None of my college profs have yet to come even close to being as cool as some of my high school teachers.

name: i_love_kate
text:
Due to the fact that we share this experience, I am going to posit that this is a universal phenomenon.

Is that ballsy of me? Oh well.

name: miku224
text: I'll chubby your ballsiness, and then pretend I didn't just write those four words.

name: offendi
text:
I like that even though Philippe's making less effort to be relevant in this one, his writing is getting pretty polished. I could probably recognize his voice if I saw him on the Tribune or something.

Also, if this is his journalistic product at age 5, what about the hypothetical situation where he gets older?
